DataElement.preferredName: Drug Accumulation Index Dose-Limiting Toxicity Risk Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Values and text that represent dose limiting toxicities defined by the risk of drug accumulation determined by accumulation index (AI).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Drug Accumulation Index Regimen-Limiting Toxicity Risk
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An index reflecting the extent of drug accumulation in the body. It is usually expressed as the ratio of the area under a plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) during a dosage interval at steady state compared to the AUC of a dosage interval after the first dose. It is affected by rate of dose administration, bioavailability, and clearance._A side effect of a drug or other treatment that is serious enough to necessitate a dose modification._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An index reflecting the extent of drug accumulation in the body. It is usually expressed as the ratio of the area under a plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) during a dosage interval at steady state compared to the AUC of a dosage interval after the first dose. It is affected by rate of dose administration, bioavailability, and clearance.

Concepts.definition: An index reflecting the extent of drug accumulation in the body. It is usually expressed as the ratio of the area under a plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) during a dosage interval at steady state compared to the AUC of a dosage interval after the first dose. It is affected by rate of dose administration, bioavailability, and clearance.

Property.preferredDefinition: A side effect of a drug or other treatment that is serious enough to necessitate a dose modification.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

Concepts.definition: A side effect of a drug or other treatment that is serious enough to necessitate a dose modification.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0484835 - 20C0023 Drug accumulation Index request 5.11.2020 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An index reflecting the extent of drug accumulation in the body. It is usually expressed as the ratio of the area under a plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) during a dosage interval at steady state compared to the AUC of a dosage interval after the first dose. It is affected by rate of dose administration, bioavailability, and clearance._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug accumulation greater than 5. It is associated with high risk of toxic drug accumulation.

Concepts.definition: A drug accumulation greater than 5. It is associated with high risk of toxic drug accumulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug accumulation of 2 to 4.99. It is associated with moderate risk of toxic drug accumulation.

Concepts.definition: A drug accumulation of 2 to 4.99. It is associated with moderate risk of toxic drug accumulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug accumulation of 1.2 to 1.99. It is associated with weak risk of toxic drug accumulation.

Concepts.definition: A drug accumulation of 1.2 to 1.99. It is associated with weak risk of toxic drug accumulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug accumulation of less than 1.2. It is associated with no risk of toxic drug accumulation.

Concepts.definition: A drug accumulation of less than 1.2. It is associated with no risk of toxic drug accumulation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
